item.title: Lisa add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you feel in your heart to be right – for you’ll be criticized anyway." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Charles W. Eliot
item.description: "Books are the quietest and most constant of friends; they are the most accessible and wisest of counselors, and the most patient of teachers." -- Charles W. Eliot

item.title: Lisa add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "A mind needs books as a sword needs a whetstone, if it is to keep its edge." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "If I can stop one heart from breaking, I shall not live in vain." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Frederick Douglass
item.description: "Once you learn to read, you will be forever free." -- Frederick Douglass

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Albert Schweitzer
item.description: "Sometimes our light goes out, but is blown again into instant flame by an encounter with another human being." -- Albert Schweitzer

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "I must not fear. Fear is the mind-killer. Fear is the little-death that brings total obliteration. I will face my fear. I will permit it to pass over me and through me. And when it has gone past I will turn the inner eye to see its path. Where the fear has gone there will be nothing. Only I will remain." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Fran Lebowitz
item.description: "Think before you speak. Read before you think." -- Fran Lebowitz

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Jules Verne
item.description: "We are of opinion that instead of letting books grow moldy behind an iron grating, far from the vulgar gaze, it is better to let them wear out by being read." -- Jules Verne

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Diane Duane
item.description: "Reading one book is like eating one potato chip." -- Diane Duane

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Horton Foote
item.description: "I’ve known people that the world has thrown everything at to discourage them...to break their spirit. And yet something about them retains a dignity. They face life and don’t ask quarters." -- Horton Foote

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Dan Brown
item.description: "Everything is possible. The impossible just takes longer." -- Dan Brown

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "I can shake off everything as I write; my sorrows disappear, my courage is reborn." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Michael Ondaatje
item.description: "She had always wanted words, she loved them; grew up on them. Words gave her clarity, brought reason, shape." -- Michael Ondaatje

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Sherwood Anderson
item.description: "Dare to be strong and courageous. That is the road. Venture anything." -- Sherwood Anderson

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Nicholson Baker
item.description: "I woke up thinking a very pleasant thought. There is lots left in the world to read." -- Nicholson Baker

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Gloria Naylor
item.description: "The music in his laughter had a way of rounding off the missing notes in her soul." -- Gloria Naylor

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I am no bird; and no net ensnares me: I am a free human being with an independent will." -- Charlotte Brontë
